briefing.opening: Good morning/afternoon/evening. We will now begin the climate briefing for December 20, 2025.

sections.title: ğŸ”´ Global Climate Crisis Warning and Social Impact
sections.content: Recent reports demonstrate that the globally intensifying climate crisis is having concrete impacts on daily life and vulnerable populations. Particularly in California, USA, news has emerged that the cost-of-living crisis is accelerating due to climate change, placing low-income individuals in even more difficult circumstances [14]. Simultaneously, in the United States, warmer weather amplified by climate change is being observed during the holiday season, leading to questions about its potential impact on Christmas trees [15, 12, 16]. Furthermore, concerns are being raised about the impact of climate change's lag time on pediatric health, emphasizing the need for urgent action to protect the health of future generations [13]. The observation that some political stances are ignoring climate change is further exacerbating this crisis and issuing a warning that it could also negatively impact national economies [1]. Despite the confirmation of abundant life in remote areas of Antarctica, news of increasing risks due to climate change serves as a reminder of the threats across the entire global ecosystem [19, 24].

sections.title: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡·ğŸŒ± Multifaceted efforts to achieve domestic carbon neutrality
sections.content: Domestically, proactive efforts are being observed across various sectors to achieve carbon neutrality goals and respond to climate change. Haenam County received a special award for its achievements in climate change response and AI energy transition, acknowledging its leading role [2]. In the agricultural sector of Yeongju, a forum on climate crisis response strategies was successfully held, exploring directions for future agriculture [3]. Furthermore, urban water-source energy is emerging as a crucial turning point for carbon neutrality [4]. Seogwipo City is encouraging citizen participation by providing energy carbon neutrality point incentives for the first half of 2025 [5]. In Goheung County, efforts are being accelerated to realize 'Carbon-Neutral Clean Goheung' through the accelerated adoption of electric vehicles [6]. Gochang County is also actively pursuing regional-level renewable energy transition efforts, including holding policy forums for the creation of renewable energy complexes [9]. These efforts, including the K-battery 'Big 3' shifting their growth engines from electric vehicles to Energy Storage Systems (ESS) and prioritizing LFP batteries [11], are also contributing to the growth of early-stage startups like JS Global, which are developing future sustainable energy solutions through technological innovation [10]. Additionally, the successful holding of a year-end futurology seminar encompassing AI and carbon neutrality academically supports these trends of change [8].

sections.title: ğŸŒ Development of Climate Response Strategies and Policies for the International Community
sections.content: The international community is accelerating efforts to develop long-term strategies and policies to address climate change. New York State in the U.S. is simultaneously pursuing the goals of strengthening energy security and reducing carbon emissions by selecting advanced nuclear power as a key means to achieve its 2040 carbon neutrality goal [7]. Scotland has established a detailed climate change plan from 2026 to 2040, presenting a long-term vision [22], and the Government of Nova Scotia is also enhancing its understanding of regional vulnerabilities by updating its climate change risk assessment [23]. Discussions on monitoring and evaluation methods to assess whether these plans are being properly implemented are also actively taking place, indicating high interest in ensuring the effectiveness of policies [21]. Researchers at the University of Arizona are deepening biodiversity and climate change research through innovative data approaches, contributing to strengthening the scientific foundation [18].

sections.title: ğŸ“° The Importance of Climate Change and Biodiversity Research
sections.content: Research into the impact of climate change on global ecosystems and the importance of biodiversity is continuously intensifying. Research over the past 30 million years on how mountain formation and climate change have shaped alpine biodiversity sheds light on the complex interactions of Earth's systems from a long-term perspective [17]. Particularly in remote regions like Antarctica, abundant life is being discovered, but these species face risks due to climate change, underscoring the urgency of biodiversity conservation [19, 24]. Research institutions such as the University of Arizona are applying innovative data approaches to this biodiversity and climate change research, playing a crucial role in understanding and predicting changes in global ecosystems [18]. These research findings will serve as crucial foundational data for developing climate change response policies.

briefing.closing: Today's climate briefing has once again underscored the escalating global climate crisis, the diverse response efforts underway both domestically and internationally, and the critical importance of scientific research. Humanity's endeavors for a sustainable future must persist. This concludes today's climate briefing.
